guide.introduction:
The kit comes with illustrated instructions that are fairly easy to follow. However, there are a few tips and tricks that this guide will cover, making the build process really easy.

This is not a detailed step-by-step. Those can be found in the magazine included with the kit. This guide points out some of the more important issues when building the kit.
guide.introduction_rendered:
The kit comes with illustrated instructions that are fairly easy to follow. However, there are a few tips and tricks that this guide will cover, making the build process really easy.

This is not a detailed step-by-step. Those can be found in the magazine included with the kit. This guide points out some of the more important issues when building the kit.

Relevant parts
  • Gakken Edo-Style clock

lines.text: Open up the box, and check your parts against the parts list in the included magazine.
lines.text_raw: Open up the box, and check your parts against the parts list in the included magazine.

lines.text: All the steps (and numbering) will directly correlate to the steps in the included magazine.
lines.text_raw: All the steps (and numbering) will directly correlate to the steps in the included magazine.

lines.text: 1.1 shows the location of the spring system. This part is used to switch between the timing mechanism for 9 - 3 and 3-9. (see instructions)
lines.text_raw: 1.1 shows the location of the spring system. This part is used to switch between the timing mechanism for 9 - 3 and 3-9. (see instructions)

lines.text: 1.2 shows the cam mechanism assembly. Simple!
lines.text_raw: 1.2 shows the cam mechanism assembly. Simple!

lines.text: 1.3 Gear assemblies attached to the winding mechanism.
lines.text_raw: 1.3 Gear assemblies attached to the winding mechanism.

lines.text: 1.4 The entire assembly is screwed to the center plate.
lines.text_raw: 1.4 The entire assembly is screwed to the center plate.

lines.text: If you plan on hooking up an Arduino, this is the time to add the metal strips as per the directions. I did not add them.
lines.text_raw: If you plan on hooking up an Arduino, this is the time to add the metal strips as per the directions. I did not add them.

lines.text: 2.1 Additional gears are added
lines.text_raw: 2.1 Additional gears are added

lines.text: Make sure the arrow on the gear faces the "notch" in the "other" gear. I have no other way of explaining this. Take a look at the picture to see what I mean.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the arrow on the gear faces the "notch" in the "other" gear. I have no other way of explaining this. Take a look at the picture to see what I mean.

lines.text: 3.1 Add the faceplate.
lines.text_raw: 3.1 Add the faceplate.

lines.text: And remove the pin (shown in picture) that held all the gears together (see instructions).
lines.text_raw: And remove the pin (shown in picture) that held all the gears together (see instructions).

lines.text: 4.1 Now you can attach the spring mechanism with 3 small screws in the back.
lines.text_raw: 4.1 Now you can attach the spring mechanism with 3 small screws in the back.

lines.text: 5.1 This little mechanism switches the rotating weights based on the time of day.
lines.text_raw: 5.1 This little mechanism switches the rotating weights based on the time of day.

lines.text: It's easy to assemble.
lines.text_raw: It's easy to assemble.

lines.text: Make sure the "square" part of the assembly is in the "rectangular" opening in the longer piece. Again, refer to the instructions.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the "square" part of the assembly is in the "rectangular" opening in the longer piece. Again, refer to the instructions.

lines.text: It is NOT completely assembled in the first picture. It is in the 2nd!
lines.text_raw: It is NOT completely assembled in the first picture. It is in the 2nd!

lines.text: Next, attach the entire assembly to the clock body with 1 screw that has an integral washer.
lines.text_raw: Next, attach the entire assembly to the clock body with 1 screw that has an integral washer.

lines.text: 6.1 It says to add the screws to this piece. I did, but found it easier to remove them and add them in a later step.
lines.text_raw: 6.1 It says to add the screws to this piece. I did, but found it easier to remove them and add them in a later step.

lines.text: 6.2 Now you can assemble 1 of the timing weights. Match the shorter one with the part as in picture 2.
lines.text_raw: 6.2 Now you can assemble 1 of the timing weights. Match the shorter one with the part as in picture 2.

lines.text: 6.3 Attach the retaining plate (arrow up).
lines.text_raw: 6.3 Attach the retaining plate (arrow up).

lines.text: 6.3 continued
lines.text_raw: 6.3 continued

lines.text: Next, attach the weight system with the longer rod to the plastic piece pictured.
lines.text_raw: Next, attach the weight system with the longer rod to the plastic piece pictured.

lines.text: And add the retaining clip (arrow up).
lines.text_raw: And add the retaining clip (arrow up).

lines.text: 6.4 find the arrow on the escapement gear.
lines.text_raw: 6.4 find the arrow on the escapement gear.

lines.text: 6.5 assemble all 3 gears as per the instructions. Make sure the arrow is lined up with the opening on the plastic plate.
lines.text_raw: 6.5 assemble all 3 gears as per the instructions. Make sure the arrow is lined up with the opening on the plastic plate.

lines.text: 6.6 Connect both assemblies together.
lines.text_raw: 6.6 Connect both assemblies together.

lines.text: 6.7 Do not forget to add the 3rd piece of plastic. This is used to hang the weights.
lines.text_raw: 6.7 Do not forget to add the 3rd piece of plastic. This is used to hang the weights.

lines.text: 6.8 Now you need to hang the weights.
lines.text_raw: 6.8 Now you need to hang the weights.

lines.text: Thread the included nylon string through the top of the weight;
lines.text_raw: Thread the included nylon string through the top of the weight;

lines.text: Next, through the hole in the plastic hanger;
lines.text_raw: Next, through the hole in the plastic hanger;

lines.text: Followed by threading it under the hanger and out the top.
lines.text_raw: Followed by threading it under the hanger and out the top.

lines.text: We will tie them later.
lines.text_raw: We will tie them later.

lines.text: 7.1 Attach the weight system to the clock body with 3 screws.
lines.text_raw: 7.1 Attach the weight system to the clock body with 3 screws.

lines.text: 8.1 Insert the square bar into the spring mechanism
lines.text_raw: 8.1 Insert the square bar into the spring mechanism

lines.text: and attach the back plate and cap (not pictured).
lines.text_raw: and attach the back plate and cap (not pictured).

lines.text: 9.1 Adjust the height of each weight mechanism.
lines.text_raw: 9.1 Adjust the height of each weight mechanism.

lines.text: You need to look inside the clock at the part that raises and lowers each mechanism (picture 1)
lines.text_raw: You need to look inside the clock at the part that raises and lowers each mechanism (picture 1)

lines.text: The rod of the weight should be 1mm above that part (when it is in the horizontal position).
lines.text_raw: The rod of the weight should be 1mm above that part (when it is in the horizontal position).

lines.text: If it is not in the horizontal position, use a screw driver to "flip it" horizontally. Adjust the corresponding weight to be 1mm above it by tying a knot in the string and adjusting the plastic weight hanger. (Look at the instructions; it's easier than it sounds!)
lines.text_raw: If it is not in the horizontal position, use a screw driver to "flip it" horizontally. Adjust the corresponding weight to be 1mm above it by tying a knot in the string and adjusting the plastic weight hanger. (Look at the instructions; it's easier than it sounds!)

lines.text: Flip the mechanism again and adjust the other weight.
lines.text_raw: Flip the mechanism again and adjust the other weight.

lines.text: 10.1 Add the dial
lines.text_raw: 10.1 Add the dial

lines.text: Wind it up and enjoy.
lines.text_raw: Wind it up and enjoy.

lines.text: I waited until I heard a large "clunk;" at that point I adjusted the dial to be 9pm.
lines.text_raw: I waited until I heard a large "clunk;" at that point I adjusted the dial to be 9pm.

lines.text: To adjust the time: Hold the clock upside down and let the spring mechanism spin. You can hold the large gear on the side to stop it when the time is correct.
lines.text_raw: To adjust the time: Hold the clock upside down and let the spring mechanism spin. You can hold the large gear on the side to stop it when the time is correct.

guide.summary: Learn how to build a Gakken Edo-style clock kit from the Maker Shed (makershed.com).
guide.title: Build a Gakken Edo-Style Clock
